description: Rhetoric and composition are academic fields within English studies that take up
the questions of how meaning is made and negotiated in a variety of historical,
geographical, and media-based contexts.  This topics course provides students
with an overview of these fields and an in-depth perspective on areas of focus
within the fields.  Topics could include: presidential rhetoric, classical rhetoric,
technical writing, interactive texts and video games, feminist rhetoric, and
community literacy.  Offered annually.  Prerequisite: FYW.
